FeedItems.Title: Developing Real-Time Communication Apps with WebSocket
FeedItems.Summary: WebSockets is a two-way communication protocol, or persistence communication channel over TCP connection, an extremely powerful protocol leveraged by numerous games, apps with chat functionality, and real-time apps such as stock tickers. In this blog post, we’ll discuss how to build a simple Xamarin chat room application that will leverage and connect to an ASP.NET […]

FeedItems.Title: DataBinding Power Moves You May Not Be Using (Yet)
FeedItems.Summary: DataBinding is a fantastic feature that cleanly decouples your UI from the backing data models while providing the plumbing to move data back and forth as you need. But, are you getting the most out of the Binding features in Xamarin.Forms? Building on our previous Introduction to DataBinding and Advanced Data Binding posts, I’ll show […]

FeedItems.Title: The Solar System with ARKit and F#
FeedItems.Summary: A few years ago, my colleague Joel Martinez and I wrote a F# program we called “Oculus Thrift” that demonstrated iOS SceneKit in a Google Cardboard stereoscopic viewer. With the recent release of iOS 11, I wanted to see if we could do something similar with ARKit, Apple’s augmented-reality framework. It took just 8 lines […]

FeedItems.Title: Microcharts: Elegant Cross-Platform Charts for Every App
FeedItems.Summary: This is a guest post from Aloïs Deniel. Aloïs works at Orange Applications for Business as a Xamarin consultant. You can find him on Twitter at @aloisdeniel and on Github at @aloisdeniel. Displaying charts in mobile apps has always been a great way to offer users a clear overview of numerical data. In my time […]

FeedItems.Title: Android Support Library v26 Overview
FeedItems.Summary: The Android Support Library v26 brings lots of new features to our Android apps, including fonts as resources, downloadable fonts, emoji support, an autosizing TextView, physics driven animations via Spring and Fling, backwards compatibility for animated vectors, and a slimmer library by increasing the minSdkVersion to 14. If it isn’t already, the minSdkVersion for all […]

FeedItems.Title: Xamarin at Local Developer Events this October
FeedItems.Summary: We’re at the height of conference season, and that means tons of new and exciting releases, tooling, and updates to talk about with your local developer community! Mobile .NET developer conferences and meetups are the perfect opportunities to learn the latest on Xamarin and related technologies while networking with other developers. Below are just a […]

FeedItems.Title: Xamarin.Forms Stable Comes to .NET Standard 2.0
FeedItems.Summary: Today, we are thrilled to share our latest stable release of Xamarin.Forms, version 2.4.0. This is our fastest, most stable release ever and we think you’re going to love it! Xamarin.Forms 2.4.0 Highlights You’ll recognize many of these highlights as shared in our public roadmap, in addition to more than 150 bug fixes. .NET Standard […]

FeedItems.Title: Webinar Recording | Exploring UrhoSharp 3D with Xamarin Workbooks Webinar
FeedItems.Summary: Folllow along with Charles Petzold as he builds a 3D app from the ground up with UrhoSharp and Xamarin Workbooks in this webinar recording. UrhoSharp is a powerful, high performance 3D graphics engine suitable for games, animation, and data visualization. Used together, UrhoSharp and Xamarin Workbooks give developers a streamlined way to get started with […]

FeedItems.Title: 3 Reasons to Try Xamarin Previews in Visual Studio 2017
FeedItems.Summary: Previews are a great way to try the latest-and-greatest in mobile development, from the new Xamarin Live Player that allows you to instantly visualize your XAML-based user interface as you type, to support for new SDKs like Android Oreo or iOS 11. Then arises the great dilemma: how do I try all the awesome stuff […]

FeedItems.Title: ActivityTask: A Helper for Async/Await on Android
FeedItems.Summary: At Google I/O, several members of the Xamarin team attended the Architecture Component talk on Android lifecycle (which I recommend you watch). While the solutions presented there are interesting and, in some cases, map to patterns we already have in .NET, it resonated with those of us present because of how those Android lifecycle details […]

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened pull request "Change md5withRSA to SHA1withRSA which is the default sig alg." (#927) at xamarin/xamarin-android
Events.RelatedBody: SHA1withRSA is now the default signature algorithm according to this JDK issue: https://bugs.openjdk.java.net/browse/JDK-6560733

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened pull request "[bcl-tests] fixes for compilation on Windows" (#926) at xamarin/xamarin-android
Events.RelatedBody:
Context:
https://devdiv.visualstudio.com/DevDiv/_build/index?buildId=1047263

There are a couple fixes to get the BCL tests (and
Xamarin.Android-Tests.sln) compiling on Windows.

The `SystemUnzip` task is passing some file paths to
`Directory.EnumerateFiles`. Since it does not appear that this would
work; in general, it seems that `GetExtractedSourceEntries` should only
return directories as a simple fix to this problem.

Next, MSBuild is getting a duplicate `<Compile />` entry passed to `Csc`
for `obj/Debug/App.cs`. There was a conditional `<Compile />` entry as
well as one added during the `_GenerateApp_cs` task. It seems simpler to
just remove the condition and the duplicate `<Compile />` entry, since
`<BuildDependsOn />` causes the `_GenerateApp_cs` task to run first.

Events.RelatedDescription: Merged pull request "Bump to mono/dev15-5-2017-06/fbc487ff" (#923) at xamarin/xamarin-android
Merged pull request "Bump to mono/2017-06/fbc487ff" (#921) at xamarin/xamarin-android
Opened pull request "[Xamarin.Android.Build.Tasks] Only Ignore Lint Checks if its supported." (#924) at xamarin/xamarin-android
Events.RelatedBody:
Fixes https://bugzilla.xamarin.com/show_bug.cgi?id=59861

We started to ignore the `StaticFieldLeak` lint check. But this
was introduced in 26.0.2 of tools. So if we try to ignore this
check in older versions it will error.

	Invalid id or category "StaticFieldLeak".

So we need to version the checks we ignore by default. This
commit puts these in a dictionary which includes the version
number you can run them from.

Events.RelatedDescription: Merged pull request "Revert PR #882" (#1190) at xamarin/Xamarin.Forms
Events.RelatedBody:
### Description of Change ###

PR #882 made a change to the template for the `TextBox` control, but in cases where the TextBox/Entry had a tall height, it would only modify the vertical alignment of the the placeholder and not the actual text, as seen below:

![before](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1251024/31354579-dea9ece0-ad04-11e7-933f-3f6ca7e4d94b.JPG)

![after](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1251024/31354583-e0ae4914-ad04-11e7-8ec2-fcd26c9fe354.JPG)

After entering text, it would still appear the same as the first photo. By default a TextBlock in UWP will place both the text and placeholder text at the top. The original report mentioned a misalignment, but using its code compared to a default UWP TextBox of the same height looks to be virtually identical, with a pixel's difference if anything (in the below case, it is Forms UWP below standard UWP):

![compare](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1251024/31354737-74881746-ad05-11e7-83db-75dbc6cf0412.JPG)

Ultimately we need to revert this original change because of the negative impact it has on the Entry.

### Bugs Fixed ###

https://bugzilla.xamarin.com/show_bug.cgi?id=60041

### API Changes ###

None

### Behavioral Changes ###

None

### PR Checklist ###

- [ ] Has tests (if omitted, state reason in description)
- [x] Rebased on top of master at time of PR
- [x] Changes adhere to coding standard
- [x] Consolidate commits as makes sense

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened pull request "Revert PR #882" (#1190) at xamarin/Xamarin.Forms
Events.RelatedBody:
### Description of Change ###

PR #882 made a change to the template for the `TextBox` control, but in cases where the TextBox/Entry had a tall height, it would only modify the vertical alignment of the the placeholder and not the actual text, as seen below:

![before](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1251024/31354579-dea9ece0-ad04-11e7-933f-3f6ca7e4d94b.JPG)

![after](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1251024/31354583-e0ae4914-ad04-11e7-8ec2-fcd26c9fe354.JPG)

After entering text, it would still appear the same as the first photo. By default a TextBlock in UWP will place both the text and placeholder text at the top. The original report mentioned a misalignment, but using its code compared to a default UWP TextBox of the same height looks to be virtually identical, with a pixel's difference if anything (in the below case, it is Forms UWP below standard UWP):

![compare](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1251024/31354737-74881746-ad05-11e7-83db-75dbc6cf0412.JPG)

Ultimately we need to revert this original change because of the negative impact it has on the Entry.

### Bugs Fixed ###

Events.RelatedDescription: Merged pull request "[All] Page embedding" (#1124) at xamarin/Xamarin.Forms
Events.RelatedBody:
### Description of Change ###

This change allows a developer to navigate to a page expressed as a Xamarin.Forms XAML ContentPage in a Xamarin iOS, Android or UWP application.

In addition to enabling this feature, this change also adds Android, UWP, and iOS native test bed projects for this feature; in the future these can be integrated into our full UI test suite.

Most of the API changes are in support of Android applications which need to support Forms pages in multiple Activities. The interesting additions are:

- `public static UIViewController CreateViewController(this ContentPage page)` for wrapping a Forms ContentPage in a UIViewController which can be used with a UINavigationController on iOS
- `public static FrameworkElement CreateFrameworkElement(this ContentPage contentPage)` for wrapping a Forms ContentPage in a FrameworkElement which can be used in a UWP application
- `public static bool Navigate(this Windows.UI.Xaml.Controls.Frame frame, ContentPage page)` which allows a Forms ContentPage to be used with UWP Frame navigation
- `public static Fragment CreateFragment(this ContentPage view, Context context)` and `public static Android.Support.V4.App.Fragment CreateSupportFragment(this ContentPage view, Context context)`, which allow a ContentPage to be wrapped in a Fragment or support Fragment for navigation in an Android application.

### API Changes ###

#### Added:

Xamarin.Forms.Internals.Registrar
- `public TOut GetHandler<TOut>(Type type, params object[] args)`

Xamarin.Forms.Platform.UWP
- `public static FrameworkElement CreateFrameworkElement(this ContentPage contentPage)`
- `public static bool Navigate(this Windows.UI.Xaml.Controls.Frame frame, ContentPage page)`

Xamarin.Forms.Platform.iOS
- `public static UIViewController CreateViewController(this ContentPage page)`

Xamarin.Forms
- `public static void SetTitleBarVisibility(Activity activity, AndroidTitleBarVisibility visibility)`

Xamarin.Forms.Maps.Android
- `public MapRenderer(Context context)`

Xamarin.Forms.Platform.Android
- `public static Fragment CreateFragment(this ContentPage view, Context context)`
- `public static Android.Support.V4.App.Fragment CreateSupportFragment(this ContentPage view, Context context)`
- `ActivityIndicatorRenderer(Context)`
- `BoxRenderer(Context)`
- `ButtonRenderer(Context)`
- `CarouselPageRenderer(Context)`
- `public static ColorExtensions.ToAndroid(this Color, int, Context)`
- `DatePickerRenderer(Context)`
- `EditorRenderer(Context)`
- `EntryRenderer(Context)`
- `FrameRenderer(Context)`
- `ImageRenderer(Context)`
- `public InnerScaleListener(Func<float, Point, bool> pinchDelegate, Func<Point, bool> pinchStarted, Action pinchEnded, Func<double, double> fromPixels)`
- `LabelRenderer(Context)`
- `ListViewRenderer(Context)`
- `MasterDetailRenderer(Context)`
- `NativeViewWrapperRenderer(Context)`
- `NavigationMenuRenderer(Context)`
- `NavigationRenderer(Context)`
- `OpenGLViewRenderer(Context)`
- `PageRenderer(Context)`
- `PickerRenderer(Context)`
- `public static Platform.CreateRenderer(VisualElement, Context)`
- `ProgressBarRenderer(Context)`
- `public static ResourceManager.GetDrawable(this Context, string)`
- `ScrollViewRenderer(Context)`
- `SearchBarRenderer(Context)`
- `SliderRenderer(Context)`
- `StepperRenderer(Context)`
- `SwitchRenderer(Context)`
- `TabbedRenderer(Context)`
- `TableViewRenderer(Context)`
- `TimePickerRenderer(Context)`
- `ViewRenderer(Context)`
- `VisualElementRenderer(Context)`
- `WebViewRenderer(Context)`
- `DefaultRenderer(Context)`

Xamarin.Forms.Platform.Android.AppCompat
- `ButtonRenderer(Context)`
- `CarouselPageRenderer(Context)`
- `FrameRenderer(Context)`
- `MasterDetailPageRenderer(Context)`
- `NavigationPageRenderer(Context)`
- `PickerRenderer(Context)`
- `SwitchRenderer(Context)`
- `TabbedPageRenderer(Context)`
- `ViewRenderer(Context)`

Xamarin.Forms.Platform.Android.FastRenderers
- `ButtonRenderer(Context)`
- `FrameRenderer(Context)`
- `ImageRenderer(Context)`
- `LabelRenderer(Context)`

#### Obsoleted: 

Xamarin
- `public static FormsMaps.Context`

Xamarin.Forms
- `public static Forms.Context`
- `public static Forms.SetTitleBarVisibility(AndroidTitleBarVisibility visibility)`

Xamarin.Forms.Maps.Android
- `MapRenderer.MapRenderer()`

Xamarin.Forms.Platform.Android
- `ActivityIndicatorRenderer.ActivityIndicatorRenderer()`
- `BoxRenderer.BoxRenderer()`
- `ButtonRenderer.ButtonRenderer()`
- `CarouselPageRenderer.CarouselPageRenderer()`
- `ColorExtensions.ToAndroid(this Color self, int defaultColorResourceId):Color`
- `DatePickerRenderer.DatePickerRenderer()`
- `EditorRenderer.EditorRenderer()`
- `EntryRenderer.EntryRenderer()`
- `FrameRenderer.FrameRenderer()`
- `ImageRenderer.ImageRenderer()`
- `InnerScaleListener.InnerScaleListener(Func<float,Point,bool> pinchDelegate, Func<Point,bool> pinchStarted, Action pinchEnded)`
- `LabelRenderer.LabelRenderer()`
- `ListViewRenderer.ListViewRenderer()`
- `MasterDetailRenderer.MasterDetailRenderer()`
- `NativeViewWrapperRenderer.NativeViewWrapperRenderer()`
- `NavigationMenuRenderer.NavigationMenuRenderer()`
- `NavigationRenderer.NavigationRenderer()`
- `OpenGLViewRenderer.OpenGLViewRenderer()`
- `PageRenderer.PageRenderer()`
- `PickerRenderer.PickerRenderer()`
- `Platform.CreateRenderer(VisualElement element):IVisualElementRenderer`
- `ProgressBarRenderer.ProgressBarRenderer()`
- `ResourceManager.GetDrawable(this Resources resource, string name):Drawable`
- `ScrollViewRenderer.ScrollViewRenderer()`
- `SearchBarRenderer.SearchBarRenderer()`
- `SliderRenderer.SliderRenderer()`
- `StepperRenderer.StepperRenderer()`
- `SwitchRenderer.SwitchRenderer()`
- `TabbedRenderer.TabbedRenderer()`
- `TableViewRenderer.TableViewRenderer()`
- `TimePickerRenderer.TimePickerRenderer()`
- `ViewRenderer.ViewRenderer()`
- `ViewRenderer<TView,TNativeView>.ViewRenderer()`
- `VisualElementRenderer<TElement>.VisualElementRenderer()`
- `WebViewRenderer.WebViewRenderer()`
- `Xamarin.Forms.Platform.Android.Platform.DefaultRenderer.DefaultRenderer()`

Xamarin.Forms.Platform.Android.AppCompat
- `ButtonRenderer.ButtonRenderer()`
- `CarouselPageRenderer.CarouselPageRenderer()`
- `FrameRenderer.FrameRenderer()`
- `MasterDetailPageRenderer.MasterDetailPageRenderer()`
- `NavigationPageRenderer.NavigationPageRenderer()`
- `PickerRenderer.PickerRenderer()`
- `SwitchRenderer.SwitchRenderer()`
- `TabbedPageRenderer.TabbedPageRenderer()`
- `ViewRenderer<TView,TControl>.ViewRenderer()`
	  
Xamarin.Forms.Platform.Android.FastRenderers
- `ButtonRenderer.ButtonRenderer()`
- `FrameRenderer.FrameRenderer()`
- `ImageRenderer.ImageRenderer()`
- `LabelRenderer.LabelRenderer()`
 
### Behavioral Changes ###

Users who have subclassed Android renderers will need to update their code to use the new constructors or they will see Obsolete warnings.

### PR Checklist ###

- [ ] Has tests (if omitted, state reason in description)
- [x] Rebased on top of master at time of PR
- [x] Changes adhere to coding standard
- [x] Consolidate commits as makes sense
